Wednesday, May 9, 2007























Aging cheddar Web site cultivates a following
Call it a cheesy publicity stunt, but one cheese maker's approach to bringing attention to a millenniums-old food-making practice has become an odd fascination on the Internet.

Satellite Internet
Satellites are the only broadband Internet choice available to as many as 10 percent of U.S. households.

Galileo project in 'crisis'
Europe's Galileo satellite navigation system is in deep crisis and will require more public funds, the European Union said.

Music copy restrictions
The last time Apple chief Steve Jobs took on major recording companies, he refused to budge on his 99-cent price for a song on iTunes.

Microsoft piracy
A court has fined a Russian headmaster half his monthly wage for using pirated copies of Microsoft software at his school.
